content.text:
This line of of myelinated axons in layer IV of visual cortex represents the axons of cells in the <image 1> 

A. Superior colliculus.
B. Lateral geniculate.
C. Retina.
D. Medial geniculate.

The image shows a cross-section of the brain, specifically highlighting a region that appears to be the visual cortex. The yellow arrow points to a line of myelinated axons in layer IV of the visual cortex. This layer is known for receiving input from the lateral geniculate nucleus (LGN), which is part of the thalamus and plays a crucial role in visual processing.

Given this information, the correct answer is:

B. Lateral geniculate.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
